title: An academic's response to Vic's planned adult time for adult crime proposal | ABC NEWS
description: The Victorian government will seek to implement adult jail sentences for children aged 14 and over who commit serious violent crimes.  Under the proposed changes, the maximum jail sentence will be raised from three years to life in the case of aggravated home invasions and aggravated carjacking by young offenders.  A bill is expected to be brought to parliament this year, with the harsher sentences to be introduced in 2026.  Interview produced by Chloe Mckenzie and conducted by Gemma Veness for ABC News Channel.‚ÄØ Social version by David Douglas Stuart for the ABC News Social Media Team. title: Indigenous protesters storm UN climate summit in Brazil | ABC NEWS
description: Dozens of Indigenous protesters forced their way into the COP30 climate summit venue and clashed with security guards at the entrance to demand climate action and forest protection.  Protesters demanded access to the UN compound where thousands of delegates from countries around the world are attending this year's UN climate summit in the Amazon city of Belem, Brazil.  Some waved flags with slogans calling for land rights or carried signs saying, "Our land is not for sale."  Security guards pushed the protesters back and used tables to barricade the entrance. A Reuters witness saw one security guard being rushed away in a wheelchair while clutching his stomach.  Another guard with a fresh cut above his eye told Reuters he had been hit in the head by a heavy drumstick thrown from the crowd. Security confiscated several long, heavy sticks.  The protesters dispersed shortly after the clash. They had been in a group of hundreds who marched to the venue.  Security guards later allowed delegates to exit the venue, having earlier asked them to move back inside until the area was clear. Within the compound, the United Nations is responsible for security.  "Earlier this evening, a group of protesters breached security barriers at the main entrance to the COP, causing minor injuries to two security staff, and minor damage to the venue," a spokesperson said in a statement.  "Brazilian and UN security personnel took protective actions to secure the venue, following all established security protocols. Brazilian and UN authorities are investigating the incident. The venue is fully secured, and COP negotiations continue."  Brazilian President Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva has highlighted Indigenous communities as key players in this year's COP30 negotiations.  Reporting by Reuters: Leonardo Benassato, Serghio Queiroz, Lisandra Paraguassu and Ben Makori, Writing by William James; Editing by Katy Daigle, David Gregorio and Leslie Adler  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: 'No scope' to stop neo-Nazis forming federal political party, AEC says | ABC NEWS
description: The NSW premier is warning anyone who supports a push by neo-Nazis to form a new political party will be outing themselves as racists. Members of neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network, who rallied outside state parliament, say they're close to having the numbers to register a party and run in elections. But while Premier Chris Minns says an application could be rejected at the state level, the Australian Electoral Commission has less scope to block the group registering as a federal political party. title: How rare is it to see a white humpback whale? ABC NEWS
description: A rare white humpback whale has been spotted on the east coast of Australia.   Whale scientist Dr Vanessa Pirotta talks to News Breakfast about Siale, the newest addition to the world's tiny population of white whales.  Until Siale, adult male Migaloo was the only known albino humpback whale to be seen on the east coast of Australia. title: Some university degrees in Australia will cost more in 2026 | ABC NEWS
description: Students starting university next year are being warned they could pay nearly $55,000 for a three-year arts degree, because of a controversial Morrison government-era policy which raised the costs of some degrees and lowered others.  If those students take out a HECS loan, new figures show their reduced earning potential means they'll be stuck paying off the debt for years.  Video by ABC Specialist Reporting Team. title: How Cryptoqueen's Chinese victims lost homes, lifesavings in Bitcoin scam | The World | ABC News
description: A lawyer representing hundreds of victims of the so-called 'Cryptoqueen' Qian Zhimin says several people have lost their life savings, while others have been unable to receive cancer treatment. The mastermind of the vast Ponzi scheme in China was jailed in Britain for over 11 years for laundering the proceeds of the fraud into cryptocurrency worth billions of dollars. Qian Zhimin pleaded guilty to two money laundering charges in September, after an investigation that saw British police seize more than 61,000 bitcoin ‚Äî currently worth over $US6 billion ($9.1 billion) ‚Äî in one of the largest ever cryptocurrency seizures. Jack Ding, a partner at Beijing-based legal firm, Duan and Duan, spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about the impact the fraudulent scheme has had on his clients. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Will US attack Venezuela after deploying aircraft carrier to Caribbean Sea? | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier has arrived in waters near Latin America, joining a massive naval buildup that has fuelled speculation the Trump administration intends to dramatically escalate its deadly counternarcotics campaign there, possibly through direct attacks on Venezuela. For its part, Venezuela is deploying weapons, including decades-old Russian-made equipment, and is planning to mount a guerrilla-style resistance or sow chaos in the event of a U.S. air or ground attack. Jennifer Parker from the ANU's National Security College spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about what to expect in the Caribbean Sea in the days and weeks to come. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Children aged 14 and above to face adult sentences under Victorian reforms | ABC News
description: Victorian children who commit violent crimes will face adult jail time, including possible life sentences, under sweeping reforms to be introduced by the Allan government.  A new bill dubbed "Adult Time for Violent Crime" will significantly increase both the likelihood of a child being sent to prison and the length of jail sentences for those who commit certain crimes.  Richard Willingham reports.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here:  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
